Author: Daniel_Day_Hubris

Comment: There are vast swaths of Eastern Germany where literally half the population voted for the AfD. In practical rather than legal terms, the party has become so big that it will be nearly impossible to actually ban it.   Also, we've already seen that the AfD voters will just flock to the next best thing if the AfD is not available:  In 2023, there were state elections in the tiny German city-state of Bremen in which the incompetent AfD state party fucked up their registration and thus failed to make the ballot. So what happened? Well, a pre-existing right-wing populist minor party called "Citizens in Rage" tripled its previous record result and took pretty much exactly the vote share the AfD would have gotten.
